newsitem.title: HONG KONG: South China Hldg in 1-for-5 warrant issue.
newsitem.headline: South China Hldg in 1-for-5 warrant issue.

text.p: South China Holdings Ltd said on Tuesday it has proposed an open offer of 76 million warrants at HK$0.38 each in the proportion of one warrant for every five existing shares held to raise HK$28.9 million.
Warrant holders were entitled to exercise their rights to subscribe to new South China shares at HK$1.90 each from the date of issue to March 31, 1999, it said in a statement.
The total value of the issue price of the warrant plus the HK$2.28 initial subscription price of a new share represented a premium of 20 percent over the shares' Monday close of HK$1.90.

South China said the net proceeds of about HK$25.5 million from the issue and the subscription money from the future exercise of the attached rights would be used as additional working capital for the group.

Robert Ng, the chairman of the company, and its directors and major shareholders had agreed to take the allotments in full with the remaining balance of 27.51 million warrants being underwritten by Earntrade Investments Ltd, it said.
The offer is managed by South China Capital Ltd, it added.
